utterance.speaker: REGINALD EASLEY
utterance.content: Mr. Hixton, is everything all right? Mr. Hixton.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kill me now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You got the cell phone bill?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, uh, books from my publisher for back cover quotes. Wait. What about the cell phone bill?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, more books to endorse. Couldn't possibly read them all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don't have to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "A tour de force in terror." - Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "Does for hot tubs what Jaws did for the ocean."

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Gram, here's a letter for you. Looks official.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bachran and Sabasta. Oh, Chet's estate lawyer. They probably resolved the probate--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Just...memory of him caught me by surprise.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Do you think he left you anything in his will?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, he certainly didn't need to, but it--

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Why--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A million dollars. Your mom must be in shock. Any idea what she's gonna do with it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I'm lucky, get a place of her own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that would be lucky. Can't find much in Manhattan for a million bucks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Foosball, basketball, a motorcycle. The owner of this place clearly had ten times that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Try a hundred. Victim's name is Jay Hixton. He won a cool 117 mil in the Florida lottery last year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then he went on a serious shopping spree. Rookie mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sounds like the voice of experience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Writing a bestseller in college is a lot like winning the lottery. I spent every penny of it in six months. Good thing I'm not a one hit wonder.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Single gunshot to the chest; from the stippling and bruising, I'd say there was a struggle. The gun went off, vaporized his heart, somewhere between eleven and two last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's a big gun. It's too big for that entry wound. This isn't the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Told you she'd spot it first off. Our victim was shot with a 9mm automatic. The bullet went straight through him. We pulled the slug out of the poker table.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so maybe our killer forces Hixton to open this safe. The .357 is hidden inside. Hixton pulls it out, but they struggle and he gets shot.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It's a winning ticket. Hard to believe a little slip of paper's worth over a hundred mil.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What would you do if you won that kind of money?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Easy. Buy a Ferrari.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have one. Not as great as you would think.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but they're hella fast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As fast as every other car in rush hour traffic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea how much money was in here?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: A hundred thousand dollars, secured in a bank bag.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, this is Reginald Easley. He's Mr. Hixton's servant.

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Servant? Young man, I am a traditional English butler. I apprenticed at Buckingham Palace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he always keep that much hard cash in the safe?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Mr. Hixton came from an impoverished background. He found having hard currency around reassuring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How many people knew that it was there?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Dozens, no doubt. He had a habit of buying everything in sight. No thought to how much money he was flashing around or how dangerous it was to tell people that there was plenty more of it at home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In New York, that's like inviting someone back to your house to kill you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he keep that gun in the safe?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: That's the odd thing, Miss. I know every item in this apartment. I have never seen a gun. But I do know he kept a dye pack in the bag that was stolen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how was it triggered?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: It was on a three minute timer that began when the bag left the apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. Grab some uniforms, canvass the area. Killer couldn't have gotten very far before that pack exploded. When was the last time you saw Hixton?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Yesterday evening. He left about five o'clock. I believe he had made plans with his wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was married?

utterance.speaker: REGINALD EASLEY
utterance.content: Oh, yes. With a teenage daughter. Though they'd been separated for some months before I began to work for him. Apparently, the money caused some kind of a rift.

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: We were so happy then. Trips to Paris and trips to Rome and cars with heated seats and...then everyone started looking at us different.

utterance.speaker: NICOLE HIXTON
utterance.content: Like we were freaks. You could see them thinking, "Why you? Why not me?"

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: And nothing we did was good enough. So we moved here. Was supposed to be a fresh start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why were the two of you separated?

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: That money, it was-- it's like poison. Jay couldn't stop spending it and...and Nicole...

utterance.speaker: NICOLE HIXTON
utterance.content: It's okay, Mom.

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: Nicole got hooked on drugs. And it was the wakeup call we needed, really. Jay and I went from not talking to getting Nicole clean. And then he started using his money for good. He found this soup kitchen in the Bowery that was in dire straits, and he said that looking at all those people in need just reminded him that if it wasn't for that lottery, we'd be right there ourselves. He started going there almost every day. It just reminded me of how much-- how much I love him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where was it the two of you ended up going last night?

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: Last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His butler said that the two of you had a date.

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: No. Jay called to cancel at the last minute. He told me something had happened, something that we had to deal with together. And I tried to get him to tell me what it was, but he wouldn't.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And where did he call from?

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: The Bowery soup kitchen. I--I think. That's where we were supposed to meet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have problems with anyone there that you know of?

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: No one in particular. It was a pretty rough crowd.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All my years as a mystery writer point to one unequivocal killer. The butler did it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, come on! How many cases have we actually had where there's a-- a butler as a potential suspect? It would be a crime if he didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he shows up the next morning and calls the cops?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pretty clever, right? Speaking of clever, I noticed at the crime scene, you never mentioned what you would do if you won the lottery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I didn't.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that because it's embarrassing? Ooh! Scandalous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I actually haven't really thought about it, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, not embarrassing or scandalous, just secretive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bad news travels fast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Winner's guilt. It's actually quite common with lottery recipients.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did anything suspicious happen with Mr. Hixton when he was here last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone you didn't know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think you could describe him to a sketch artist?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, our mystery man goes to the soup kitchen, waits for Hixton, and then takes him...where? He wasn't killed for another six hours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why wait? I mean, if the guy wanted to rob Hixton, why not just take him home and empty his safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then there's Hixton's gun. Why did he need it, and where did he get it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, according to CSU, nowhere legal. The serial numbers were filed off the gun, and Hixton's prints were on the bullets in the chamber, which means he loaded it himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Found our lottery winner's money bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where'd you find it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Alley behind Hixton's building. It was empty, but, as you can see, the dye pack in the bag went off. And it must've gotten on our killer's hands, because we got prints. Belonging to one Todd Shipley, a maintenance worker in Hixton's building. He got off right around the time Hixton was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but if he's a maintenance worker, he could've picked up the bag after the dye pack went off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don't think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either that guy really likes Avatar--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he's our killer.

utterance.speaker: TODD SHIPLEY
utterance.content: I swear, I found the bag on the ground and when I opened it, it went off in my face.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That bag was on a three minute timer. Are you telling us that you accidentally picked it up at exactly the wrong time?

utterance.speaker: TODD SHIPLEY
utterance.content: Man, I'm telling the truth! I--I'd just gotten off work, stopped to get a soda, when I saw someone running out of the alley.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This, uh, someone that ran away, what'd they look like?

utterance.speaker: TODD SHIPLEY
utterance.content: I-- I don't know. It was dark.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So is your future, Todd, if you don't start telling us the truth.

utterance.speaker: TODD SHIPLEY
utterance.content: Man, I am! Yo, ask Mr. Lee at the Korean grocery. He--he-- he's the one who sold me the soda.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Timer was set for three minutes. There's no way he could've gotten downstairs from the 20th floor and bought a drink before the dye pack exploded. All right, tell me this. Did you see Hixton in the building at all during your shift?

utterance.speaker: TODD SHIPLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, I was in the lobby when he came home around eleven. Uh, he was sweating like he'd been walking, and since he left early in his Escalade, I asked him where his car was. He said someone had taken it from him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, Mr. Lee confirmed Shipley's alibi, and Hixton's car is definitely missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it can't be a coincidence that on the same day Hixton's car was taken he was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The killer could've gotten Hixton's home key when he took his ride.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Address was on the registration. He liked the car so much, he drove over to rob the apartment, got caught in the act.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but why would Hixton go home? Why wouldn't he call the police, report the theft?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Tracking company's got a lock on Hixton's Escalade. Looks like it's heading west on Canal Street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's the Holland Tunnel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our killer's making a run for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Name's Shawn York. Jersey police caught him driving Hixton's car down the turnpike. No sign of the stolen money, though.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No disrespect to our Jersey brethren, but let's check that car again. Make sure that that money's not hidden behind a door panel or inside the wheel well.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan, what would you do if you won the lottery?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Winery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See? Everyone thinks about it.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Everyone thinks about what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What they would do if they won the lottery.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: A big-ass boat, 60 footer, monster spinnaker hanging off the bow, two deep sea rods hanging off the stern.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, while you guys are fantasizing about the size of your rods, I'm gonna go and interrogate our suspect.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: Can I get a soda?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm not your flight attendant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm a homicide detective.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: I'mma say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're a bit of a rambler, Shawn. Assault in El Paso, criminal trespass in Memphis, and now first degree murder in New York City.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: Wait, time out. Who did I kill?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jay Hixton.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: No. He was alive when I saw him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was at the soup kitchen where you jacked his car. But then you got greedy and you followed him to his apartment. He ends up dead, you end up a 100 grand richer.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: I didn't kill the guy, and I sure as hell didn't steal his car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then how did you end up driving his car?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: He gave it to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He gave you a $70,000 car? Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: I heard on the street Hixton believed in second chances, so I tracked him down. Told him I was down on my luck, and Hixton said he didn't have his checkbook, but did I want his car? I thought he was yanking my chain. Who does that? But, you know, he signed over the title and handed me the keys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He just signed over the title just like that?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: Yes, ma'am. Said he wasn't gonna need it any more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night at midnight?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: I went to the late movie near my apartment. They're having a Tony Jaa marathon. Can I have that soda now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Theater clerk confirms selling York the ticket, and Hixton's signature on the car title is authentic. Who gives away their car?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone who can afford to buy a thousand new ones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, at six o'clock Hixton gives York his car, and then at eight o'clock he calls his wife and cancels dinner. Told her that there's something they need to talk about, something that they both need to deal with together. Then he gets home at eleven o'clock and about an hour later he's killed. So, what was he doing in the meantime and with whom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the guy did like to spend money. If he made any charges on his credit card last night, might get us close to where he was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, if he spent any money the night he was killed, it was cash. There were no charges on any of his 32 credit cards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 32 credit cards?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. One for every NFL team, and that's just the tip of the iceberg. He also bought a racehorse, minority stake in a lingerie football team, and a Bentley which is currently at the bottom of the Hudson River because he drove it off of a boat he was renting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, sounds like that money really turned Hixton into a different person for a little while.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, money doesn't change who you are. It just magnifies your personality.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, it wasn't all bad. He also bought a house for the clerk that sold him the winning ticket, a mausoleum for his dead neighbor, and three acres on the moon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get outta town. He's right down the crater from me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why doesn't it surprise me that you have property on the moon?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? Laugh it up. When the earth is a desiccated husk, you will be begging to come live with me in the Nectaris Basin.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So, I searched the car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Sorry, York is not our guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That's okay. Jersey impound lot's nice this time of year. So, no money, as expected. But I did find this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A camera?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lodged under the front seat. Clearly it belongs to Hixton.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are surveillance photos.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, a dozen of them date stamped last week. Hixton was following this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, contact the family and butler, see if anyone recognizes him. Meanwhile, we've got a hole in our timeline that needs to be plugged. So, we know that Hixton called his wife at 8 p.m. and we know that he wasn't at the soup kitchen. Let's ping the carrier, see if they know where he was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would you quit your job? If you won the lottery, would you quit being a cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what else would I do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Supermodel. Brain surgeon. American Gladiator.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, you got me there, Castle. I've always wanted to leave the force and become an American Gladiator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why don't you want to tell me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so there's nothing really to tell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, you must have a dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure I do. Solve this case, go home, take a nice long bath. But it doesn't look like that's going to happen tonight. Hixton's phone carrier. Hey, Esposito! That phone call to Hixton's wife came from the 500 block of Lexington. I don't think we can get a more exact address. We're gonna have to canvass.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, maybe not. I just saw a Lexington Avenue in his financials.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Right here. He wrote two checks last month. $10,000 each to a company called Meech Industries.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meech? Logan Meech?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, he's listed here as the owner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I must've arrested that guy like half a dozen times. He's a low-rent scam artist with a history of violence. Last time I busted him, he was trying to grill cheese a guy in a dry-cleaning press.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why would Hixton be writing checks to a character like that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Logan Meech.

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: Detective, I love what you've done with your--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sit down.

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: Hey. Who's the new guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? You want to send him Christmas cards from death row?

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: What? Wait. I didn't kill anybody.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, it's just a coincidence that you were with Jay Hixton shortly before he was shot to death in his apartment.

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: What, Hixton's dead? Ugh. He was, uh, one of my investors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? What is it Mr. Hixton was investing in?

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: My relief organization.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why is it I'm thinking the only relief Mr. Hixton's money provided was to your own bank account?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Hixton get onto your scamming him? Did he threaten to go to the cops? Is that why you killed him?

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: I told you I didn't kill him. I--I hadn't seen him in weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's funny, because I talked to your landlord and he said that he remembers clearly seeing Hixton at your place last night. So, either you start telling us the truth and playing ball, or I call the D.A. and get them to draw up murder charges.

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: Okay, look, hang on a minute now. Um, maybe I, uh, I misspoke, okay? Um, Hixton did actually pay me a visit last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: He wanted a gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: Uh, protection. He was scared. He paid me a grand for a-- a .357 that I was holding for a friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what was he scared of?

utterance.speaker: MEECH
utterance.content: His past. He said it was coming back to get him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does that mean? His past was coming back to get him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why go to Meech for a gun? Why not just go to the police or hire a bodyguard?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe he didn't think they could protect him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU finished processing Hixton's apartment, came across two sets of finger prints that were in the system. Couple of career criminals from Hixton's hometown in Florida.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Greg and Ty Page. Previous busts for bank robbery and currently serving a nickel for grand larceny?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, well, that info's a little bit behind. They were released last week due to overcrowding.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, get to the part about who they robbed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A month after he collected his jackpot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Even though they wore ski masks, he recognized them by their voices because they grew up together. It was his testimony that put them away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hixton must've heard they were being released and worried they were coming after him again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to Florida police, the brothers were in town for all of two days before they packed up their car and headed up north. Told a neighbor that they were going hunting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like they bagged themselves a lottery winner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Looks like you made a serious dent in your surprise inheritance. Is it safe to say there is not an animal print left in any store in New York City?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Very funny. Probably true.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, congratulations. Looks like you have successfully completed the first stage in the five stages of hitting the jackpot: shopping.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What's the next stage?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you are my lottery winning victim, you turn to charity and then get shot to death in your living room.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I'll pass. Besides, I've decided to give back the money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Why?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, I was about to break up with the man. Do you really think he would've left me that money if he'd known that? No. No, I'm going to return all this stuff, I'm going to give back the money. It's the right thing to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you've just jumped to stage five. Enlightenment.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. Then again, Chet did adore me. So, I think I should be able to keep one thing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It's not real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Detective Beckett. Did you call to tell me a bedtime story?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which car is theirs?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The maroon one over there, Florida plates. It's registered to a Greg Page. We put an alert on their plate number, which got triggered when a traffic cop ticketed them about an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea where they are?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: None. So, we watch the car until someone shows up. Any sign yet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That's a negative. A winery, huh?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny and I visited one on our first vacation together.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A hundred mil and you're gonna become a farmer? Your fiancée really has done some damage on you, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Like Lanie hasn't changed you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie?!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Come on, dude, we-- we all know about the two of you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What--? Castle and Beckett know, too?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said earlier that money doesn't change us, it just magnifies who we are. What did your windfall magnify in you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My inner child. At first. Kind of like Hixton. The one who likes, you know, private jets, five star everything. But then I realized the only luxury I truly care about is freedom. The freedom to write, spend time with Alexis. Having that money just...allows me to live life on my terms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You grew up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn't go that far. That property on the moon?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just bought that last month.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who's this guy?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo. Dreadlocks, twelve o'clock.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD, let me see your hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Page brothers, where are they?

utterance.speaker: DREADLOCKS
utterance.content: Upstairs.

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Sexy as hell as I come through the door.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: 12 gauge shotgun. Get on the floor.

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Jump on the counter, let off a round.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: You wet yourself as you hit the ground.

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Take command with my outside voice.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: We're robbing this *****. We ain't got no choice.

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Don't hit the alarm. Don't beg for your mama.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: Seal up that bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut it down.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: Move--

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: What the hell, yo? That was slamming!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Three armed cops and a writer makes four. You're under arrest. So, get on the floor.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Got about 60 grand here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where's the other 40 you took from Hixton's safe when you killed him? You spend it on your rap career?

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Nah, you've got it all wrong, Shorty. We didn't kill the man. We came up here to help him.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: Got out the joint for good behavior. Dude called us up, said he needed a savior.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stop rapping. I'll buy the album. Savior?

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Yeah. His daughter got back into drugs. He needed to make things right, so he called us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The two of you robbed Hixton at gunpoint in Florida. Why would he call you?

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: When Hixton realized what kind of trouble Nicole was in, he knew we were the only people he could turn to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what could you possibly do to help his daughter with her addiction?

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Problem wasn't the drugs. It was her dealer. Her cat named Oz. Nicole was under his spell something fierce. When Hixton found out about it, he went to go see Oz, told the man, "Stay away from my daughter." When Oz didn't, he called us. You don't believe me, look in my wallet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Nicole lied to me when she told me she didn't recognize him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's the guy Hixton had under surveillance. Is this Oz?

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Yep. When Hixton called us, we drove right up here, jumped Oz outside this club downtown.

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Yo, Ty hit his bodyguard with a pipe, I stuffed Oz in the trunk, drove under the bridge and beat on his ass. Then we came straight here. Been bouncing tunes ever since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that true? Did they come here last night?

utterance.speaker: GREG PAGE
utterance.content: Yeah, we told the man to "stay away from Nicole, or we're gonna put your ass in the river." He told us we should do it, 'cause if we let him live, he was gonna burn us alive. You want to know who killed Hixton, gotta be Oz.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Hixton gets a gun to protect himself from Oz. He can't get the cops, 'cause that'll get his daughter in trouble.

utterance.speaker: TY PAGE
utterance.content: What the hell was that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan, watch them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stay right where you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Oz wasn't kidding when he said he'd burn them alive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it true, Nicole? Did you start using again?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE HIXTON
utterance.content: After I got clean, Oz found me. He said he wanted me back.

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: Nicole.

utterance.speaker: NICOLE HIXTON
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Mom. I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: And your father knew?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE HIXTON
utterance.content: He blamed himself. He said that he was gonna fix it all, but I never thought...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This Oz, you think he's capable of killing your dad?

utterance.speaker: NICOLE HIXTON
utterance.content: This is all my fault. Dad is dead because of me.

utterance.speaker: NOREEN HIXTON
utterance.content: It's okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oz, AKA Marvin Osminkowski.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No wonder he changed his name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to Vice, he has a lucrative gig peddling high end product to the city's rich and famous, and a car bomb is definitely his M.O. Competing dealer got blown up last year, but didn't have enough evidence to convict.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Oz shoots Hixton for ordering the beat down, and then attempts to barbeque the Page brothers to complete his revenge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let's go pick up Oz.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, well, that's gonna be difficult. According to Vice, Oz pretty much operates off grid. The only time he's on is when he's dealing out of word of mouth night clubs. And, even there, he's got a network of bouncers, waiters, and patrons as lookouts. If Oz catches one whiff of bacon, he vanishes into thin air.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There's gotta be some way to slip under the radar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we're gonna need your Ferrari.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my. Look at you. Oh, you look gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm just gonna grab my keys and change.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You two going out on a date?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. We're just doing a little undercover work. So, how are you doing?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ahhh eh. I've been better.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle told me that you decided to give the money back?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I tried. Chet's kids refused to take it. They said their father loved me, wanted me to have the money. So, I'm...you know, trying to figure out what to do with it. Everything I come up with seems so selfish and petty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it doesn't have to be that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, someone once told me that money doesn't change you, it just magnifies who you are. You cared about Chet. Maybe you could do something that would honor his memory somehow.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That is a lovely thought. Thank you. Really, thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Got the keys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, great. I'm driving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're driving? Beckett, this is-- this is a Ferrari. It is a high-performance vehicle designed to respond instantaneously to your every whim, your every movement, every--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Nice car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get us some drinks and keep your eyes peeled for Oz, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Drinks. Got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, come on, please. You gotta let me go in there and see him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that's because I just came into town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ibiza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, a little birdie told me all about you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Said that you know how to keep a party going all night long.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, prove it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um. I like to feel shiny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's okay. Good things always do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! Handcuffs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then let's take an even bigger step down. Into a prison jumpsuit. I got you dead to rights on possession with the intent to sell. That's 20 years federal time. But that's nothing compared to time that you're gonna do for first degree murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not to mention felony blowing crap up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You remember this guy? You should. You killed him. And these two you tried to kill with a car bomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here's the thing, Marvin, we showed your picture around Hixton's place. Oddly enough, people saw you there right about the time he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Page brothers gave you a serious beating. You vowed revenge, and then Hixton shows up dead with witnesses claiming to see you at the crime scene? That doesn't look good for you, Marvin, and lying to us will only make it worse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were hot to straighten Hixton out and you changed your mind. Do you really expect us to believe that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You get a good look at this guy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The butler really did do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easley, the butler. Loyal, devoted, seemingly distraught over the death of his master. Yet all the while, lurking behind that mask of servile correctness, was a killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or Oz is just trying to kick up some dust. I mean, what's the butler's motive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, in fiction it would be one of two things. Firstly, he was carrying on a torrid affair with his master's wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Second, had to be the money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think Castle might be on to something. I dug a little deeper into Reginald Easley, and his last few employers all say the same thing. Easley resigned after some of their valuables went missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I realize I've been thinking about this all wrong. You're not a frivolous person, so you wouldn't do frivolous things with your lottery winnings.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. I'm gonna figure this out. If you e--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Packing your things?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: These aren't my things. They belong to my employer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Must be hard being around all this wealth and none of it yours.

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: I'm content with my lot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? We read up on you. Born in Leeds to a single mother who was a seamstress. With the right training, you lost the lowbrow accent and learned to fit in with the gentry, where you saw people spend more in one day than your mother made in an entire year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then along comes Hixton, a man with an upbringing not unlike your own. But he owned all this. And he owned you. Not because of any special talent or intelligence, just because he guessed six numbers. And you didn't. And taking from Hixton wasn't really stealing, it was just correcting a karmic injustice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You made him open that safe, but what you didn't know was that he had a gun. And when he reached for it, this is where it ended.

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: What on earth makes you think that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that you were here the night that he was killed, Mr. Easely. Long after you said that you had left.

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Early on, he bought 25 first edition Dickens. Charles Dickens. The man didn't even read. He just liked the look of the leather on their spines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Easley--

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: I stole two of them. To me it was like levying a tax on him for being an idiot, but then I had a change of heart. I brought them back here that night around eleven o'clock, thinking he was out with his wife. But, for some reason, he was here. I-- I heard the shower running.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your excuse for coming back here the night that he was killed was that you had a change of heart?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Yes. I'd like to say it was because his turn to philanthropy made me see him in a different light, as a good man one shouldn't steal from. But the truth is, I was scared his bad luck would become mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He won over a hundred million in the lottery. One could hardly consider that bad luck.

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: Mmm. His marriage failed, his daughter fell into drugs, and he was just gunned down in his own apartment. That, sir, is the universe - what did you call it? - Yes, correcting a karmic injustice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: The winning lottery ticket. Hixton let it slip one night after a little too much time with the bottle. He always played the same numbers. The dates he and his wife met and were married. 1-3-95 and 10-24-98.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: None of those numbers are on the ticket.

utterance.speaker: EASLEY
utterance.content: All the misery that came from the money? Hixton believed it was because he stole the ticket.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: So, you think Hixton was murdered because he stole the ticket?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on. I mean, it was worth a fortune.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Easley had every reason to make up that story. And even if those weren't Hixton's regular numbers, it still doesn't prove that he stole the ticket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the theft explains so much about Hixton's behavior. The director of the soup kitchen said that Hixton compulsively gave away his money like he felt he didn't deserve it. I called it "winner's guilt." But what if it was another kind of guilt entirely?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Let's say that you're right. Let's say that Hixton stole the ticket. There's still no evidence suggesting that that contributed to his death.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're the first person to tell me that there are no coincidences in a murder investigation.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hold on, Detective. He's got a point. You said Hixton told Meech his past was coming back to get him. Now, we thought he meant the Page brothers, but this ticket represents the biggest thing that ever happened to him. I call that a major motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Then, if it's true, how do we prove it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 2, 4, 8, 19, 41, and 79. I know it's a long shot, but if we can figure out what these numbers signify, we might be able to find the ticket's real owner.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I play my kids' birthdays.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I play my firsts. Sex and combat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I play his firsts, too. What? That way we both win and it's not awkward.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, sorry. I don't play, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But, if you did?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, doesn't really matter, Castle. I mean, the fact is, Hixton won the lottery a year ago. If he stole that ticket, why didn't the rightful owner come forward sooner?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Maybe the rightful owner is dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Hixton killed him. The moon. The weird purchases Hixton made as soon as he won. He bought three acres on the moon and a mausoleum for his neighbor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find out everything we can on this neighbor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'm on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If you're right, Castle, I'm betting Hixton's neighbor never imagined that the luckiest day of his life would also be his last.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Booyah! Neighbor's name was Hank Walters. He died the day the winning numbers were announced.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Walters' birthday: 2/8/41. Three of the numbers in the lottery ticket.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two days later, Hixton came forward to claim his 117 million dollar check.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did Walters die of?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Natural causes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For real?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. He was an old man dying of, like, six different things. Lanie went over the autopsy, said everything looked like it was on the up and up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Walters is bedridden. Hixton, like any good neighbor, asks the old man if there's anything he can do for him. Walters says, "Yes. Buy me a lottery ticket." Maybe it was a one time thing, maybe he did it all the time. This time, numbers are announced and Walters won. Hixton rushes back to tell him and finds Walters dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And doesn't know what to do. That's why it took him an extra day to come forward. He was struggling with the moral implications.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. But desperate times call for desperate measures. He claimed the ticket as his own. Clearly no one else knew about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about family? Did Walters have any?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, according to the county records, he only living relative of Hank Walters is a nephew named Tom. And guess where he lives?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: New York City.

utterance.speaker: TOM WALTERS
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Are you telling me that I might inherit a hundred million dollars?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come on, Tom. You already figured that out. You confronted Hixton. You told him you wanted restitution. He said no, things got ugly, and Hixton ended up dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, you grabbed what was in the safe, and you took off.

utterance.speaker: TOM WALTERS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Knock it off, Tom. You're the old man's only living relative. You're the only one with motive for revenge.

utterance.speaker: TOM WALTERS
utterance.content: No. I'm not his only relative. He's got a son.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, he doesn't. We checked.

utterance.speaker: TOM WALTERS
utterance.content: Well, sure, he's not biological. Hank dated his mom for, like, five years while the kid was growing up. The two bonded like crazy. Kept in touch even after the romance broke up. They even spend every holiday together for the last ten years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This son, is his birthday 4/19/79?

utterance.speaker: TOM WALTERS
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because those are the three remaining numbers on the winning lottery ticket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You lied to us about who you are, Shawn. These are your Dad's numbers. Your birthday and his.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: I don't know what you're talking about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When did you realize that Hixton had stolen the winning ticket? Was it when you were still in prison in Memphis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or was it after you got out, went to go and visit your Dad, found out he was dead? And that his mausoleum was paid for with the stolen winnings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can't imagine how you must have felt. How driven you were to come to New York, make things right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You tracked down Hixton at the soup kitchen, threatened him with all kinds of things if he didn't do right by you. He freaked out. He gave you his car. But that wasn't enough, was it?

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: You can't prove any of this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can prove all of it, Shawn. We found the money from Hixton's safe in your apartment with trace amounts of his blood on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what happened next? I mean, why would you walk away with only a hundred grand? He owed you millions.

utterance.speaker: SHAWN YORK
utterance.content: Hm. I went to his apartment to collect what was mine. He told me I didn't deserve the money. Said that I was a dirt bag criminal and all I was gonna do, if he gave it to me, was put it up my nose. Instead, he was gonna give it all away to those in need. I told him I was in need. Then he grabbed for my gun. It went off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what's gonna happen with all that money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that's for the lawyers to decide. The good thing is that Nicole is going back into rehab and her mom's gonna be there for her when she gets out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, at least something good will come of all this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
